t: Romans 9
Israel’s Rejection of Christ
I*p speak the truth in Christ- I am not lying; my conscience testifies to me through the Holy Spirit-
that I have great sorrow and unceasing anguish in my heart.
For I could wish that I myself were cursed and cut off from Christ for the benefit of my brothers and sisters, my own flesh and blood.
They are Israelites, and to them belong the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the temple service, and the promises.
The ancestors are theirs, and from them, by physical descent, came the Christ, who is God over all, praised forever. Amen.
God’s Gracious Election of Israel
Now*p it is not as though the word of God has failed, because not all who are descended from Israel are Israel.
Neither is it the case that all of Abraham’s children are his descendants. On the contrary, your*i offspring*i will*i be*i traced*i through*i Isaac.*i
That is, it is not the children by physical descent who are God’s children, but the children of the promise are considered to be the offspring.
For this is the statement of the promise: At*i this*i time*i I*i will*i come,*i and*i Sarah*i will*i have*i a*i son.*i
And not only that, but Rebekah conceived children through one man, our father Isaac.
For though her sons had not been born yet or done anything good or bad, so that God’s purpose according to election might stand—
not from works but from the one who calls - she was told, The*i older*i will*i serve*i the*i younger.*i
As it is written: I*i have*i loved*i Jacob,*i but*i I*i have*i hated*i Esau.*i
God’s Selection Is Just
What*p should we say then? Is there injustice with God? Absolutely not!
For he tells Moses, I*i will*i show*i mercy*i to*i whom*i I*i will*i show*i mercy,*i and*i I*i will*i have*i compassion*i on*i whom*i I*i will*i have*i compassion.*i
So then, it does not depend on human will or effort but on God who shows mercy.

For the Scripture tells Pharaoh, I*i raised*i you*i up*i for*i this*i reason*i so*i that*i I*i may*i display*i my*i power*i in*i you*i and*i that*i my*i name*i may*i be*i proclaimed*i in*i the*i whole*i earth.*i
So then, he has mercy on whom he wants to have mercy and he hardens whom he wants to harden.
You*p will say to me, therefore, “Why then does he still find fault? For who resists his will?”
On the contrary, who are you, a human being, to talk back to God? Will what is formed say to the one who formed it, “Why did you make me like this?”
Or has the potter no right over the clay, to make from the same lump one piece of pottery for honor and another for dishonor?
And what if God, wanting to display his wrath and to make his power known, endured with much patience objects of wrath prepared for destruction?
And what if he did this to make known the riches of his glory on objects of mercy that he prepared beforehand for glory-
on us, the ones he also called, not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles?
As it also says in Hosea, I*ipn will*i call*i Not*i My*i People,*i My*i People,*i and*iln she*i who*i is*i Unloved,*i Beloved.*i
And*iln it*i will*i be*i in*i the*i place*i where*i they*i were*i told,*i you*iln are*i not*i my*i people,*i there*iln they*i will*i be*i called*i sons*i of*i the*i living*i God.*i
But*p Isaiah cries out concerning Israel, Though*ipn the*i number*i of*i Israelites*i is*iln like*i the*i sand*i of*i the*i sea,*i only*iln the*i remnant*i will*i be*i saved;*i
since*iln the*i Lord*i will*i execute*i his*i sentence*i completely*iln and*i decisively*i on*i the*i earth.*i

And*p just as Isaiah predicted: If*ipn the*i Lord*i of*i Armies*i had*i not*i left*i us*i offspring,*i we*iln would*i have*i become*i like*i Sodom,*i and*iln we*i would*i have*i been*i made*i like*i Gomorrah.*i
Israel’s Present State
What*p should we say then? Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have obtained righteousness - namely the righteousness that comes from faith.
But Israel, pursuing the law of righteousness, has not achieved the righteousness of the law.
Why is that? Because they did not pursue it by faith, but as if it were by works. They stumbled over the stumbling stone.

As it is written, Look,*ipn I*i am*i putting*i a*i stone*i in*i Zion*i to*i stumble*i over*i and*iln a*i rock*i to*i trip*i over,*i and*iln the*i one*i who*i believes*i on*i him*i will*iln not*i be*i put*i to*i shame.*i
